snippet: A speech by President Hassan Rouhani of Iran and an online video showing his commanders appearing to fight rebels in Syria point to Iran’s dual tracks in the civil war.
abstract: New Iranian Pres Hassan Rouhani tells Revolutionary Guards commanders that the country will support whomever Syrians want as their leader even if it is not Pres Bashar al-Assad, staunch ally of Iran; statement appears to be part of Rouhani's diplomatic push to present himself as more conciliatory than his predecessor, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.
lead_paragraph: A speech by President Hassan Rouhani of Iran and an online video showing his commanders appearing to fight rebels in Syria point to Iran’s dual tracks in the civil war.

headline.main: President’s Speech and Online Army Video Point to Iran’s Dueling Interests in Syria
headline.print_headline: President’s Speech and Online Army Video Point to Iran’s Dueling Interests in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
